common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch during startup
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch, often stuck at "ensure core dependency" stage. This issue appears across Windows and macOS, potentially due to stricter hardware requirements in newer versions or OneDrive conflicts. Updating to the latest version (11.1.2 as of the last report) is recommended, and providing log files can help diagnose the issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:**

- User @MR-AAYU reported an issue with the Pieces Desktop application not booting up.

**Key Points Raised:**

- User is unable to launch PiecesOS on their desktop.
- User provided minimal details about the issue.

**Problems Identified:**

- The root cause of the booting issue is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Pieces support bot provided links to related issues and resources.
- @mark-at-pieces requested log files from the user for further analysis.
- User agreed to provide the log files.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The conversation is ongoing, with the user expected to provide the requested log files.

**Additional Notes:**

- The conversation indicates that the Pieces support team is actively engaged in resolving the user's issue. 
- It's important for the user to provide the requested information to facilitate a timely resolution.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points:**

* User reported problem: Unable to launch the Pieces Windows Desktop Version (11.1.1).
* Issue identified as related to stricter hardware requirement in 11.1.1.
* Proposed solution: Update to version 11.1.2 and provide log files for troubleshooting.
* Temporary solution: Provide logs located in c://users/{username}/documents/com.pieces.os/production/support

**Problems:**

* Pieces Desktop Version (11.1.1) not launching due to stricter hardware requirements.

**Proposed solutions:**

* Provide logs for troubleshooting.
* Update to version 11.1.2 that addresses the hardware requirement issue.

**Implemented solution:**

* Version 11.1.2 released to address the problem.

**Current status:**

* Issue closed as resolved.

**Additional notes:**

* Patience is appreciated as the team worked on a fix.
* User confirmation is requested to ensure the issue is fixed.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of the GitHub issue conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a very long time to boot up (cannot run) and is stuck at "Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application".
* **Platforms affected:** Windows and macOS.
* **Troubleshooting steps:**
    * Update to the latest version (11.1.1).
    * Check for OneDrive conflicts.
    * Update to the latest version (11.1.2).
    * Close and reopen the app.
* **Potential cause:** Migration of user data during a major update.
* **Workaround:** Update to the latest version of the app.
* **Planned fix:** Patch to prevent hanging in the future.

**Problems Identified:**

* **Slow boot-up time:** Users reported that PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up.
* **Stalled progress:** The app gets stuck at the "ensure core dependency" stage.
* **OneDrive conflicts:** Conflicting files in OneDrive caused issues for some users.
* **Hangs:** The app hangs on macOS.
* **Broken links:** Links in the app don't work well with Firefox on Windows.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Updating to the latest version:** Updating to 11.1.1 and 11.1.2 resolved the issue for most users.
* **Removing OneDrive conflicts:** Removing conflicting files in OneDrive helped some users.
* **Closing and reopening the app:** This workaround helped on macOS.
* **Planned patch:** A patch is planned to prevent hanging in the future.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved for most users by updating to the latest version.
* A patch is planned to prevent future hanging issues.
* The broken links issue will be addressed in a future update.

**Additional Notes:**

* This summary is based on the information available in the GitHub issue conversation.
* The issue was initially reported on Windows and macOS. While the solutions provided address the Windows issues, the workaround for macOS may not be permanent.
* Users are advised to update to the latest version of the app and follow the recommended troubleshooting steps.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a missing AVX2 instruction set support on older CPUs. The Pieces team addressed this by releasing version 11.1.2, which includes a fix for the AVX2 dependency issue.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `gonzososa` reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on their system.
* The issue was related to AVX2 support not being available on their CPU.

**Identified Problems:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch due to lack of AVX2 support on user's CPU.
* User's CPU was outdated (released before 2016/2017).

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* Pieces team released version 11.1.2 with a fix for the AVX2 issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User `gonzososa` confirmed that version 11.1.2 resolved the issue for them.

**Additional Notes:**

* Pieces team provided helpful troubleshooting steps and resources to the user.
* Other users experiencing similar issues were informed about the fix and directed to update to version 11.1.2.

**Overall, the issue was successfully resolved through collaboration between the user and the Pieces team.**

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Problem:** User `GetReal444` reported an issue booting up the PiecesOS application. The error message in the logs indicated a problem with the `CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch` extension due to missing AVX2 support on their processor.

**Solutions:**
* **Mark-at-Pieces:** Suggested gathering additional information by sending the logs folder from the Support directory.
* **tsavo-at-pieces:** Identified the issue as a failing dependency of the AVX2 vector library on certain platforms.
* **Resolution:** Released a patch in version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS to address the AVX2 dependency issue.

**Outcome:**
* `GetReal444` confirmed the issue was resolved after updating to version 11.1.2.

**Key Points:**
* The issue affected multiple users due to hardware limitations.
* The Pieces team identified and addressed the issue quickly.
* The user confirmed the resolution was successful.

**Additional Notes:**
* The issue was related to previous issues #620, #624, and #625.
* The team is actively working on a permanent solution for the AVX2 dependency issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS login and account linking issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems logging in, linking accounts (Google, GitHub), and launching Pieces OS. Issues involve stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1, account linking flow problems, and potential email capitalization conflicts. Solutions include updating to the latest version (11.1.2), providing log files, and waiting for a new account linking system.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User is unable to link their GitHub and Google accounts in Pieces app.
* Current account linking flow is not user-friendly and needs improvement.
* There is a single character capitalization difference in user's email addresses for GitHub and Google accounts.
* User is willing to wait for the new account linking system to be implemented.

**Problems identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not straightforward and confusing.
* Capitalization difference in email addresses might be causing linking issues.
* Old auth service provider has limitations and causes annoyances.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Manually merging accounts by Pieces support.
* User provided screen recording of the linking flow for troubleshooting.
* Resetting user's GitHub account for linking attempt.
* Implementing a new account linking system in the next few weeks.

**Current status/outcome:**

* User is waiting for the new account linking system to be implemented.
* Existing linking attempts were unsuccessful due to potential capitalization issue.
* Pieces support is resetting user's GitHub account for future attempt. 

**Additional notes:**

* User is a senior IT engineer and believes the capitalization difference should not be causing the issue.
* User is willing to be staged for early access to the new account linking system.

**Overall, the issue is still ongoing and will be resolved with the implementation of the new account linking system.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Startup and Network Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to start, often due to dependency errors or conflicts with local installations like Ollama. Network connectivity issues also arise, hindering cloud service and local LLM access. Solutions include reinstalling, verifying dependencies, checking network configurations, and using updated Pieces OS versions.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Server Issues on Pieces OS

**Key Points:**

* User `johnkennyuk` encountered CUDA errors (specifically `cublas64_12.dll`) when using Ollama server on Pieces OS.
* The issue seemed related to an incomplete/broken installation or conflicts arising due to multiple Ollama installations.
* The user eventually resolved the issue after several uninstalls, path cleanups, and ensuring only one Ollama instance was running at a time.

**Problems Identified:**

* Multiple Ollama installations conflicting with each other.
* Broken or incomplete Ollama installation causing Cuda errors.
* Pieces OS trying to start its own Ollama instance even when an external instance was already running.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling Ollama and Pieces OS completely and then reinstalling them.
* Ensuring only one Ollama instance is running at a time.
* Cleaning up environment paths and ensuring they point to the correct Ollama installation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue seems to be resolved for the user after several troubleshooting steps.
* The user requests additional features in Pieces OS to better handle external Ollama instances.

**Additional Notes:**

* The exact cause of the issue remains unclear, but it might be related to a conflict between Pieces OS and externally installed Ollama.
* The user suggests improvements to Pieces OS for better detection and management of external Ollama instances.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) encountered problems with Pieces, including:
    * Difficulty making requests to Pieces cloud services
    * Trouble with local models
* Possible cause identified as potential firewall or network configuration issues blocking outgoing requests from PiecesOS

**Problems Identified:**

* Network issues hindering communication with Pieces cloud services and impacting local model functionality

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review logs related to PiecesOS and local models
* Schedule a call for further investigation

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User uploaded logs for analysis
* Access granted for reviewing logs
* Call scheduled for deeper troubleshooting 

**Next Steps:**

* Analyze logs to pinpoint the root cause of the problems
* Conduct a call with the user to discuss and resolve the issues

common_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Connectivity and Local LLM Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces cloud services and utilizing local LLMs.  This issue presents as error messages related to cloud service connectivity and local LLM functionality. Proposed solutions include checking network connectivity, switching networks, and verifying PiecesOS and application versions.  The Pieces team is actively investigating these issues and providing support to affected users.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @AmanSingh766 reported an issue with downloading a local LLM in the Pieces application.
* The user received an exception: "Connection closed before full header was received".

**Problems identified:**

* The user was unable to download local LLMs.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support team asked for support logs from the user.
* The support team suggested trying the download again.
* The issue may have been resolved in version 11.1.2 of Pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user has not responded with further updates, so it is unclear if the issue has been resolved.

**Additional notes:**

* The support team provided helpful resources, including links to existing issues, documentation, and the Pieces YouTube channel.

**Overall, this conversation highlights the support process and communication between users and the Pieces support team.**

Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) encountered problems with Pieces, including:
    * Difficulty making requests to Pieces cloud services
    * Trouble with local models
* Possible cause identified as potential firewall or network configuration issues blocking outgoing requests from PiecesOS

**Problems Identified:**

* Network issues hindering communication with Pieces cloud services and impacting local model functionality

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review logs related to PiecesOS and local models
* Schedule a call for further investigation

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User uploaded logs for analysis
* Access granted for reviewing logs
* Call scheduled for deeper troubleshooting 

**Next Steps:**

* Analyze logs to pinpoint the root cause of the problems
* Conduct a call with the user to discuss and resolve the issues

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Rohit0072 is experiencing issues booting up the Pieces app.
* The issue has been automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* Related issues 602, 456, and 618 are suggested for reference.
* Pieces team member, mark-at-pieces, acknowledges the issue and provides contact information.
* The issue is related to other reported issues (#620, #624, and #625).
* A fix is expected to be released by the end of the day (EOD) on February 13th, 2025.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app fails to boot up.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update to the latest 11.1.2 version of PiecesOS.
* A fix is expected to be released by EOD on February 13th, 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue closed on February 17th, 2025, assuming the update or fix resolved the problem.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is related to other reported issues, suggesting it might be a widespread problem.
* The Pieces team seems responsive and acknowledges the urgency of the issue.

recommendations: Prioritize addressing the "PiecesOS fails to launch" issue, focusing on startup dependency conflicts and OneDrive interactions.
Investigate and resolve the AVX2 dependency issue to ensure compatibility with older CPUs.
Improve the account linking process, addressing potential conflicts and usability issues.
Provide clearer guidance on resolving network connectivity issues affecting cloud services and local LLM access.
Consider implementing a system to detect and manage conflicts with local installations like Ollama.
